title: Chris Leck
text:
Chris Leck (born 21 May 1986 in <a href="Manchester">Manchester</a>, <a href="England">England</a>) is a <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. He plays as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%239.%20Scrum-half">scrum-half</a>.
He started his pro career at <a href="Sale%20Sharks">Sale Sharks</a> where he remained up until the end of the 2011 season. He then signed for <a href="Edinburgh%20Rugby">Edinburgh Rugby</a> where he mainly played as understudy to Scottish internationalists <a href="Mike%20Blair">Mike Blair</a> & <a href="Greig%20Laidlaw">Greig Laidlaw</a> as well as competing against Welsh cap <a href="Richie%20Rees">Richie Rees</a> 2014 in the <a href="Pro14">Pro12</a>.
His crowning moment came in the 2012 <a href="Heineken%20Cup">Heineken Cup</a> quarter final game against Tolouse. Leck was summoned from the bench with Edinburgh trailing 14-7 at half time to help secure a famous 19-14 win, securing the club's first ever European cup semi-final appearance.
However, shortly afterwards he suffered a shoulder injury that would ultimately keep him out of the team for the next year, an injury that required three operations. With the departure of previous coach <a href="Michael%20Bradley%20%28rugby%20union%2C%20born%201962%29">Michael Bradley</a> and the appointment of <a href="Alan%20Solomons">Alan Solomons</a>, along with the appearance of Scots youngsters <a href="Sean%20Kennedy%20%28rugby%20union%29">Sean Kennedy</a> & <a href="Sam%20Hidalgo-Clyne">Sam Hidalgo-Clyne</a> he was released from his contract at the end of the 2013-14 season having never played for his new coach.
